Overall the flavors weren't bad but the cold food and soggy chips ruined it for me. I'll not be returning.
author: Jane W.

description: I am a big fan of Chipoltle but this location is not up to par with the brand. I live close by and this is my go-to spot about once a month. About 75% of the time I've had a bad experience. For example, today they ran out of lettuce, tortilla chips, barbacoa, carnitas, sofritas (tofu), lids for the bowls. There is overall poor management. One of the reasons I love Chipoltle is for their fresh sustainable ingredients. I often order a salad and on more than one occasion, this location has run out of dressing and will not get more in until a few days later. It's very surprising with such fresh ingredients they can't make more dressing in-house. Today, there was a long line and there were two employees wiping the counters instead of serving the customers. The orders were backed up and the food was getting cold. Frankly it is unacceptable. I think this location needs better management and better quality control.
author: Debbie L.

description: Folks, make sure to head on over to this Chipotle location if you like finding medium length, brown hair that is buried deep in your burrito. Talk about the most inappropriate experience of my life.
author: Justine M.

description: This location used to be great... The last two times have been ok but today was the pits. First no carnitas...ok, not the end of the world but not good. Then the staff wanting to clock in/out step in front of the cashier preventing him from ringing a customer. Customers should be the priority not clocking in. Finally at the napkin/utensil/drink area it is messy and all out of forks! Tough day I guess. Maybe the staff all sees the writing on the wall that the stonestown location is going to hurt the business.
author: K H.

description:
my first time eating at this place, and i was far from impressed. 

is the brown rice just as nasty as the white rice? cuz the white rice was pretty nasty. wasnt too crazy about their pinto beans, neither. now im reading more reviews, and i see that this place offers "healthy" burritos. had i known that before, i would have eaten elsewhere.

the carnitas even tasted healthy. no bueno! the entire burrito just had a dry, unsatisfying taste to it. even the chips and salsa i always order with every burrito was ruined by this place. what kind of "salsa" is this? 

the best thing about this experience was the advertising on the packaging. never again.
author: Charles V.

description: The worst Chipotle EVER!!!!!!!!!  Slow workers, dirty food stations, disgusting dining area, employees not washing hands after they sweep the floor, employees not wearing hats while prepping food, slow dull service by cashier.  I have already contacted corporate of this branch in Lakeshore Plaza and they were kind enough to send me 2 burrito cards.  I will use this elsewhere.  The worst......
author: Sam J.

description: So I'm a fan of chipotle for convenience and somewhat fresh ingredients. When I heard the shopping plaza by my house was getting a chipotle I was excited. However, in my opinion the portions here are liiitle stingy. Other Chipotle's I go to my burrito or burrito bowl are way bigger. Don't get me wrong I still go here from time to time, but I have lower expectations in the portion department.
author: Sandhya R.

description: Got through the line and my burrito was about five inches long with a three inch diameter. I asked why and the cashier said they were told to make smaller portions. Still cost nine dollars though.
author: Stephen B.

description: I ate here yesterday. I must say the burrito I had tasted "off" but couldn't put my finger on it so ate it anyway.  I was up all night and half the morning with FOOD POISONING. DO NOT GO HERE.  END OF DISCUSSION!!!!
author: Ngeean x.

description:
I've been here twice and had gotten corn tacos both times to go. I live down Ocean about a 3 minute walk away and by the time a get home, the tortilla has split apart. 
I ended up having to eat my tacos with a spoon.
I wouldn't come here again.
author: Monica M.

description: The sloat chipotle is awful. The whole Chipotle experience lacked consistency which chain restaurants are known for. It started with the girl who took my to go burrito bowl order. Though perky, she can't make a burrito bowl or even a regular burrito to save her job. She slapped everything into the bowl. At the end my bowl was messy and not all the way full. The aluminum lid wasn't even put on correctly and was dented in one area. The cashier guy wasnt any better. He was slow and didnt seem to know the menu. The staff seemed untrained. The manager of this location should do something and maybe visit one of the downtown locations where the burritos are made to look good and are consistent with other Chipotles that I have been to.
author: Trudie S.

description: Really good food, if you go in the morning, or at night they gave you huge portions. Really friendly customer service. Nice area. Compact, but worth all your while!!!
author: Andre M.

description: I am a HUGE fan of chipotle, but the three times I have been here I have consistently been disappointed. Every time I have come (at different times in the day) the burrito line has been very messy, which is not very nice to see. My boyfriend always received his quesadilla undercooked and we have to ask to have it grilled a second time. The service is also not great, the people who have served me have been very helpful but there was one time that my boyfriend and I came (around 4 pm) and I believe it was a shift change as randomly two steps into my order the server walked away and all of them stood talking around the register for at least ten minutes, completely ignoring us and the other patrons waiting in line. Will not be coming back to this location.
author: Mary C.

description: I've been here 4 times and each time its been worse than the time before. This is the only location I've ever had a problem with. The quality of meat at this location is lower than low. Last night I found a chunk of bone I'm my burrito. I also did not take a single bite where I didn't have to spit a piece of meat out. Its inedible. So tough I couldn't bite through it. On top of all that today my girlfriend woke up puking. I would seriously steer clear of this location.
author: Brennan S.

description: They said their salsa is not spicy but it's burning my mouth. Just because you can take spicy stuff doesn't mean everyone else can, too. The service was rude also.
author: Sky F.

description: I went to this chipotle for the first time tonight and was very disappointed! I love chipotle but did not leave happy tonight. They jipped me on everything, and other customers I saw them make burritos for. I had to ask for more rice and more cheese because they barely put any. And my burrito was ripped when I opened it at home. Also, my girlfriend got a quesadilla and when she opened it at home they didn't even cut it into pieces and the cheese wasn't melted all the way! She had to throw it in the microwave. I will most likely not go here again even though it is closest to where I live. Westlake will have to do! Hope this helps...
author: Ryan M.

description: My family and I love Chipotle and we go to a variety of Chipotle chains in San Francisco. I don't think I will be coming back to this place. I know its a small place and seating is limited. When we were through ordering our food, they asked us is this to go or for here? Well if there was somewhere to sit we would eat here. looking around i noticed that there was two employees siting at a four seat table. I thought it was really rude that they did not get up for paying costumers to sit and eat, and the Manager should of told them to move so the costumers could eat at the tables. Also we ordered a casadilla for my daughter and when we got home it was not in the bag. The employees were so busy chatting that they forgot to put our food in the bag. When we went back to get the food, they said it was our fault for not grabbing it, when it was clearly not in our bag that was handed to us. I am very disappointed and disgusted with poor service at this restaurant. We will not be returning to this chain and we will now be going to the one at Stownstown. Management should really concentrate on what customer service is and retrain all their employees again on being kind and inviting.
author: Sophia R.

description:
Great location with GREAT Staff!

I gave up on Daly City. I am a firm believer in giving feedback, both positive and negative, to help a company improve. I wrote several letters to Chipotle Corporate about the poorly run Daly City location. Employees with lose hair, training employees to wait until the chicken or peppers are GONE and customer requests them before they bother even starting to cook more. Can't tell you how many times I've had to stand there waiting for a certain item. 

After growing tired of dealing with Daly City, I tried the Sloat location. OMG! What a difference. They act like the old days when Chipotle was new and cared about service. The employees are friendly (and speak english instead of tagalog), and they LOOK at the items and anticipate when things are starting to run low, and start cooking in advance. I'm a fan again!

So bottom line, if you love Chipotle, don't give up on them just because Daly City Westlake location sucks, go to the one on Sloat. It's literally 5 minutes from the Daly City one and you don't have to deal with putting your life on the line driving through little Manila (Westlake Center), and you can get in and out without sacrificing ingredients.

The only downside is it's (slightly) more expensive than the non-SF ones, my guess is because they have to cover the cost of SF's minimum wage and\or Healthy SF, but I'm 100% okay with that!
author: Andrew B.

description: Tasty burritos. Friendly and fast service. Fairly healthy.
author: Patrick S.

description: Why does everyone hate this place?  It's not bad.  Their food is fresh, they give you tons, and just maybe, there might be a line.  I have never ate in, but i mean it has been clean every time I've been there.  Chipotle is the perfect place for a quick, fresh bite.
author: Praise C.

description: My first experience at Chipotle...passed by it many times but finally got to try it with my kids. Service was friendly but lacking experience. I told the guy I wanted a chicken burrito and 2 orders of the taco kit kids meal so the guy heated up my tortilla and asked me what meat and rice I wanted. I chose the brown rice & chicken. He then passed the tray to his co-worker next to him for me to choose the toppings. While I'm telling the lady what I wanted, he's asking me what my kids wanted. At the same time, the lady is asking me if I wanted guacamole and other things! I told the man to hold on so I could finish telling the lady what I wanted in my burrito. He then says, so do you still want the taco kits? Yes, but I can only answer to one person at a time! Geez Louise! The kids meal was a good deal. For the taco kit @ $4.60, they got a tray with their choice of meat, rice, corn & 2 tortillas, chips and a drink (juice or milk). I didn't know they charged an additional $2 for a splat of guacamole. The taquerias usually charge $1 extra. Anyhow, the burrito wasn't bad. I like the fresh ingredients but the tortilla is very dry and chewy and wasn't wrapped tight enough. Once I bit into my burrito, everything came apart so I just ate it with a fork instead. I wished they had a steamer to steam the burrito so it's nice and hot like the taquerias. Instead the salsa, sour cream, guacamole & corn made the burrito taste COLD!!! I wouldn't crave to come here but if I'm in the neighborhood and feel like having a burrito, I'll stop by. One thing I didn't like is that they didn't have pictures or descriptions to help people sort their trash. People were throwing napkins in the black bin when it's suppose to be compost and mostly everything was in the trash instead of the appropriate bins. If you're going to promote healthy eating, help care for mother earth too!
author: Mimi C.

description: Oh, Chipotle. I really don't like you but you position yourself so strategically. No one reading this review is likely to have never experienced your lackluster white-girl Mexican food so I won't go much into that other than to say that although your burritos are easy to eat quickly in the car in between work or classes or whatever, it is because your tortillas are nearly rock solid. Is this a good thing? I guess it is...sometimes...cuz I've done it more than once. Perhaps this is more a review of my laziness than your quality. Which is why I am giving you three stars. My laziness is A-OK.
author: Alan P.

description: The food here is okay. I had their burrito bowl and it was pretty good. The burrito bowl is essentially all the ingredients you would find in a burrito, but just eaten out of a bowl. Although the taste of the food was decent, I wasn['t really wowed by it. It tasted like "americanized" mexican food that you would make at home . If you are craving for some real mexican comida this is not the place. I would only come back here if I'm craving for "americanizeD" mexican food. The service here is okay and the restaurant is clean .
author: Lucy C.

description: It's a chipotle, no complaints on the meal itself. Why I gave it 2 stars was because of how it is run. I went around 7:30pm and they were out of white rice, fajitas, and black beans. In addition, they placed my burrito bowl with several others and there was a large confusion at the cash register. Their only redeeming quality, which is why I gave them two stars over one, is that they give good portions of meat on their burritos (a common issue at chipotle).
author: Erik V.

description: It's ok. Nothing special really. There are better burrito/mexican places. But its nearby. Burritos are kinda small though for the price. I expected better.
author: Nikita K.

description: Obviously any of the amazing taquerias in the Mission have better burritos.  With that said, Chipotle does an incredible job of offering up a great tasting meal very quickly.
author: Anthony B.

description: ive never been to a bad chipotles. that being said, this chipotles is like all the others. good quality food with great service. there isnt a lot of seating so if you plan to eat, take it to go. the only reason why its 4 stars is due to the poor burrito rolling skills and a lady gave me attitude for asking for a quesarito (i was the only person in line)
author: Zachary H.

description:
Great food, but they skimp on the proteins... if you're not careful, you'll only get half of what they should give you... and if you call them on it, you'll get dirty looks or they will try to charge you extra...

This isn't just me saying this... read below and you'll see I'm not the only one. My wife constantly complains about this to me too... yet, we always put up with this because of the great flavor/texture of the food...
author: Gene G.

description:
I had a 2-for-1 coupon so my boyfriend and I decided to try Chipotle.  This was the first Chipotle experience for both of us, so I didn't have any other locations to compare it to.

The place is simple and clean.  Service was very friendly and efficient.  Based on some other reviews, maybe it took some time for employees to be trained at a new location, but I couldn't have asked for better service.

I knew about Chipotle's reputation for using good ingredients, which was part of the appeal for trying it out.  Unfortunately, the quality of the meat (I had chicken, bf had steak) was pretty disgusting -- it looked good behind the counter, but it ended up being lots of fat and gristle.  After we each gagged and spat out several mouthfuls, we ended up picking most of it out, and even our cats wouldn't touch it.

Another downer was that the rice just didn't seem right -- too much citrus taste, and a little dry -- but it would have been okay if the meat hadn't been so gross.  The tortilla and salsa were very good, and the burrito was wrapped well.  I thought portion size was average, not as teeny as others have indicated, though it's hardly a taqueria super burrito that you could get (with chips and guacamole!) for the same or lower price and the same or better quality.

It wasn't terrible, and my star rating would be higher if there weren't so many better, cheaper alternatives for the quality of food.  If I were to go back, I'd definitely stick with a veggie option.  I'm just glad we had the coupon, or I really would have felt cheated.

This place defines the "Meh.  I've experienced better" description of a 2-star rating.
author: Jenny S.

description: I really wanted to rate this location 3 stars and I actually spent probably 5 minutes debating it (which is far to long to think about a yelp rating), but after careful consideration I have to go with 2 stars. But in the immortal words of fellow Yelper Allan L., "Dude, come on Lakeshore Chipotle."  You totally have skimped on the fillings in my burrito twice... I ordered vegetarian and literally got 3 pieces of green pepper as my filling. I'm not asking for a fully stuffed burrito, but more than 3 pieces of pepper would have been nice.  The place is also so chaotic every time I go.... I think that may have more to do with indecisive customers and the big groups that seems to flock into the restaurant ahead of me, but still.  Because of the chaos, I've almost gone home with the wrong food.... TWICE! The people who work there are really nice and try to be accommodating, but even in spite of them, I never have a really great experience when coming to this Chipotle.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Flavors are good. Bowls are piled high which I like but what killed it was the rice was not cooked through. Any harder and itll be raw rice grains.
author: Darren Z.

description: This location either is just the worst or hates me. When I order a burrito (typically a fajita burrito) I ALWAYS have to ask for more peppers and stuff. They skimp.  No other location does this so bad. When I have someone else pick me up my burrito, it usually comes back around small as heck. This the only location this ever happens at so my guess is this location is trained to make them that way. Be sure to get lettuce on your burrito if you want it a decent size compared to other locations. I've been to tons of locations and have had chipotle at least 100-120 times over the years. Typically love it, but this location is so bad it needs to be called out. Wife just brought back a burrito  for the family (where she admits she wasn't paying attention to every one of them being made) and a couple were only around 4" long. And pretty much no peppers in mine.
author: Koobie S.

description: Came in one night an hour prior to closing and they were out of chips?  Really?  Never been a huge fan of Chipotle in general.  Usually get a burrito or children's quesadilla.  I love their chips and guac though.
author: Noreen F.

description: I don't know why we try to go here anymore.  My boyfriend and I started going to this location when it first opened.  It was great, but then the next few weeks they started running out of everything.  How does a business do well when they run out of everything?  First of all Daly City never does, and I have had always great service from there.  This location; however, has failed since the first month of this location being open.  We use to love the help here, but that has changed too.  Even when they didn't have guacamole or sour cream or chicken, we still came here for the service, but now this is not the case, so we both decided to go to Daly City and They gave us a discount for the bad service Sloat gave us... Sloat didn't even bother to offer that.  We both work in very high-end customer service jobs and believe in providing feedback.  For us we would rather go to a location that is always stocked with items of what they sell, and Great customer service, instead of an unprepared location, with bad service.  We both will not go back here even though it is five minutes from our house.  I would rather drive to Daly City, than to worry if the Sloat location will be out of guacamole, sour cream, or CHICKEN or ALL 3 at the same time... horrible. If I could give 0 stars I would.
author: Kristina R.

description: My husband and I love Chipotle in general. The food is fresh and delicious. With the Lakeshore plaza location, there is often something missing. Some of the staff are sometimes sloppy in the way they prepare the food. This evening we found avocado seed bits in our burrito. To the staff: Please maintain the high quality we are used to and be a little more careful when preparing food. Imagine how you would wish someone else to prepare food that you will eat.
author: Rima E.

description: This place has horrible service and never anything in stock.  How does a food place run out of Chicken?  That is a staple for you!  Then to give bad customer service on top of that.  Someone woke up on the wrong side of the burrito.  Come on now, and you ran out of guacamole? How does that happen?  Don't you all make that yourself?  I mean I will go buy you some avocados and make it if it's about being lazy.  Man this place is always out of stuff.  Even sour cream! Now I'm no genius, but I will go to Lucky's across the way and buy it for you all... I don't know about you guys, but this place lacks creativity.  I worked for a food place and use to buy stuff for my business if it ran out. Oh wait you all grow that yourself, well then maybe you need to start thinking a little more and have things in stock because this is ridiculous.  I have advice for everyone going here: Call ahead to see if they have anything you want because they might only have tortillas and lettuce possibly some brown rice and maybe some cheese... You might only be able to get a quesadilla... if you're lucky.
author: M R.

description: Portions are inconsistent. The girl gave us so little compared to the rest of the people around us. Truly disappointed.
author: Jen T.

description: The staff here are absolutely rude! I bought a steak burrito for 7.56, I gave the cashier $8.01 hoping to get 45 cents in change, the cashier gave me 35 cents and 10 pennies! I was furious ! That was just rude! I am not coming to this chipotles anymore !1 star is for the food not the service!
author: Sue K.

description: I have been a fan of this place from day one. it is the best burrito I have ever had. However... PLEASE DO NOT TRAIN INCOMPITANT EMPLOYEES ON CUSTOMERS!!! These truly are the best ingredients in S.F. and I still eat here twice a week. But when I see ripped and torn burritos given to customers that are obviously too compassionate to speak up, it pisses me off. I have witnessed this in several locations. I eventually learned to ask for a competent person to prepare my food and ended up in a questioning issue...EVERY location has told me "well, it is a very watery burrito".   BS, Chipoltle. I will always come back. but I hate how much food you just throw in the trash.
author: punk l.

description: Great food! BIG PORTIONS and friendly service!
author: Zuleima J.

description: First don't order over the phone or online because last time I ordered both online and over the phone for pickup. When my mom went to pick it up they said that I never called which there were lying because they called me back twice to make sure of the order then when someone comes in you tell them its not ready and never called. I would not order from this place. You're gonna lie to you're customers to get a better customer service.
author: Mybraceletsify L.

description: good average mexican food... still not up to par to my local mexican joint back in sac
author: Jaseon F.
